name: Sheraton Grand Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife booked this Hotel for my birthday, she booked a Club Suite and we were shown to a Classic Suite in error, this was soon sorted out and we got a Castle Suite with a lovely view.
reviews.title: FIRST CLASS HOTEL

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights as the hotel was doing an offer 3 nights for the price of two. Our suite was excellent, huge and spotlessly clean. A lovely bedroom with a king size bed, tv etc. a roomy lounge with sofa, chairs. tv dining table and chairs. Tea, coffee and biscuits, also mineral waters daily, and a lovely box of chocolates. The bathroom was superb. seperate bath and shower, toiletries, etc. Enjoyed the facilities of the Club lounge, breakfast excellent and drinks at night. Spa was very good too. Would go back any time, loved it. Staff all very helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Can't fault

reviews.text: Through travelling for work, I've been lucky to stay at a couple of Sheraton hotels. This one is no different in that it is of high quality.
reviews.title: Pay for an upgrade

reviews.text: The staff were friendly, rooms were large and clean and breakfast/room service was good.
reviews.title: A bit disappointing ...

reviews.text: Location is reasonably central and you're about a 10/15 minute walk from the main sightseeing bits.
reviews.title: Undergoing refurbishment. Don't visit until they're finished.
Quality in the heart of the city
reviews.text: We've stayed at the Sheraton several times over the past few years, twice in the last couple of months and it never fails to impress. Now the refurbishment of the restaurant & bar is complete, it's looking better than ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms at the Sheraton are quiet & comfortable ( great blackout curtains !!) and the valet parking is excellent.
reviews.title: Amazing & Luxurious

reviews.text: One thing I will commend is the excellent concierge service. On a recent trip (5 couples, travelling together) we were let down at the last minute, by the restaurant we had booked months earlier, the Concierge selected some suitable alternatives, printed some menus to help us select, then sorted reservations for us. Top class !!!
reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE

reviews.text: We travelled here for a nice get away from London.
reviews.title: A very classy, luxury hotel
Exceptional service
reviews.text: This hotel is great. Slap bang in the middle of the city centre and if lucky your room will have a view of the great castle. Staff were first class. You must have a gin and tonic in the bar!!

Had an amazing time staying at this hotel. The service was excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room is spacious, modern and clean. The spa is WOW. Loving the rooftop thermal pool! One of the most relaxing weekends in my life.
reviews.title: Great Hotel + Great Spa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about this place. Well done guys. Will definitely stay again next time in Edinburgh.
reviews.title: best spa ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: from arrival staff were friendly and information. hotel was beautiful and the room i stayed in was very modern and stylish. very good place to go if you want to get away and unwind yet still be within walking distance to city. loved the pool and spa area alot on offer and very good value for money :)
reviews.title: REAL REVIEW - Sheraton Grand Hotel & Spa - November 2012
Best hotel spa we've ever been to
reviews.text: Myself and my partner stayed at the the Sheraton Grand hotel & Spa during our trip to Edinburgh. After reviewing numerous hotels in Edinburgh we were stuck on which to choose. I was looking for a hotel of a high quality and was not too bothered about the price as it was only for one night. The room we stayed in was the basic double room, but please take note that I use the word 'basic' very loosely as there was nothing basic about it. I am glad to say that choosing the Sheraton was not a decision I regret. The standard of quality from the moment I walked in until the moment I left was of the highest standard.
Good points: Valet parking, central location, high qaulity luxury service, mood lighting bathroom, large comfortable bed, unique selection of gin based cocktails, spa (with rooftop hydro-pool)
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: In July I stayed at the Sheraton Grand Hotel for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. As a preferred gold member of Starwood's frequent stay program, I was upgraded from a standard king room to a wonderful king room with a super view of the castle. The room rate was approximately $250 for a single person and included breakfast in the Terrace Restaurant. The room featured Sheraton's Sweet Sleeper bed which was wonderful. The room also had a good-sized sitting area with a sofa, chair, and table with a number of current magazines. The air conditioning was very welcome since our other hotels in Europe were sweltering during the heatwave. Upon check in, I was given a choice of newspapers to be delivered to my door each morning.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location
Not a 5 star hotel
reviews.text: The breakfast was outstanding and included a buffet and cooked to order breakfast items. The buffet items were very fresh and had a good assortment of fresh fruits, cheeses, cold meats, breads, eggs, yogurts, pancakes, freshly squeezed juices, and other items.
The hotel was in a convenient location to the bus lines and tour bus. Taxis were also available all day. There were also a number of inexpensive pubs and cafes within walking distance of the hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: One of the highlights of the stay was the use of the facilities at the One Spa. The outdoor hydrotherapy pool was very cool as were the rest of the outstanding spa facilities.
The hotel was expensive but not overly so considering the great service and hotel accomodations in an expensive city. I highly recommend staying at the Sheraton Grand Hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have extensively studied TA before deciding: there is a wide selection of hotels in Edinburgh, but there is always something reviewers did not like about. Now, at the time of our visit (July '12), this place was after a heavy renovation and we bear with the customers that have stayed and reported on its progress. This allowed us to perfectly time our stay. We have not stayed previously and cannot compare with what was before. Nonetheless, a comparison of Sheraton, Starwood and direct competitors, on a worldwide scale, would have this place emerge favorably.
reviews.title: Top pick
Only stayed one night, but it was excellent!
reviews.text: What remains in our memories 4 months after our 3-nights-stay:

Primo, a perfect check-in and check-out: one could feel the care the hotel attaches to a friendly and personalized encounter. No need to insist with you, the weathered travelers and TA readers, on its importance: half of all complaints about 5-stars properties on this site might be around check-in / room allocation / check-out!
reviews.title: Best hotel of my holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secundo, the view: If you care about, book a room with castle view, it is probably one of the images of Edinburgh you wish to keep in your memory.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Terzio, a very modern room, adequately fitted, with an important bath and restroom section, the latter nicely kept on its own: you might go for a morning shower and a relaxing evening bath ...
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great place to stay. Very comfortable and clean rooms. Room service very good. Restaurant in hotel was also very good. Spa was excellent! Most enjoyable is that you could walk from this hotel to old town, the castle, shopping, restaurants etc. It was very convenient.
reviews.title: Perfect Location in Edinburgh

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for three nights I. October of this year. It is truly first class The hotel and rooms are spectacular . the restaurant had great food, the staff were very mannerly and helpful .I had a premium room so I had full access to the fabulous spa . I also enjoyed the privilege lounge for breakfast and drinks and snacks later in the day. would highly recommend this hotel .
reviews.title: Fantastic views of the castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Relax, refresh, chill out, enjoy the views, be pampered, be made to feel very special by the great staff... what more???
reviews.title: If you want spa/fitness, top service and beautifully appointed rooms then go Sheraton

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at the Sheraton we felt totally welcomed by the very friendly and helpful front of house staff. They offered advice on local destinations and could not have been more friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.text: We stayed here for a couple of nights and enjoyed a stonking room with castle view and a super-king bed. The room had super-smart mood lighting and great audio visual options.
reviews.title: Excellent third visit and great Club Lounge

reviews.text: After a dissapointing last visit when the hotel was being refurbished, we decided to come back to see how it has turned out. Well, it's very very good. Only a one night stay so didn't use the spa, but the bar was lovely and relaxing - and very reasonably priced too. Staff all friendly and helpful and the room and public areas were spotless. The only downside we can think of was rather poor water pressure in the shower - as we are in ( and from ) Scotland I know there's plenty of the stuff to be had so to have a rather measly dribble for a shower isn't what I would expect. Otherwise top marks though...
reviews.title: Back to form

reviews.text: I stayed here for fun while seeing a rugby match at Murrayfield.
reviews.title: This one only goes up to 5 not 11

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, the modern conveniences of the hotel and the quality of the gym. I didn't use the spa but it looked amazing from what I could tell. Hi-speed internet is very fast.
reviews.title: Fabulous get away
Very good
reviews.text: The hotel is located at the end of Prince Street and at the bottom of the castle so it's very convenient to everything. There's a taxi rank on the plaza (accessible from the 2nd floor) if you need a taxi. There are great restaurants within walking distance. And although the hotel isn't as posh as something like the Balmoral, I'm more inclined to stay in a more modern facility.
I'd highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Large, chic hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well were do i start service just first class from the minute we drove up to the minute we left, treated like royalty the whole time. The room was just stunning and clean, we were in a castle view room which was great and the bed you just cant beat . The bed could have fitted 5 of us in it. We managed to get a day in the spa one and upgrade into the club lounge for a day and cant get over the value for money for a 5 star hotel great value! And the spa was world class!!!! It really was the perfect place to spend the weekend for my partners 30th birthday. We would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Just Brilliant!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on Sat 16 April. Rooms are lovely and modern, newly refurbished. Bathroom very stylish with colour change lights, although very confusing when trying to put toilet light on in middle of the night, and all the lights come on and end up waking your partner up! Air con did not work very well in our room, but was not overly hot, and bed was super comfy. Did not have breakfast in hotel, as thought £20 each was very overpriced! Staff very friendly and professional and would stay again.
reviews.title: Thoroughly recommend this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay the the Sheraton in Edinburgh was a positive experience that will never be forgotten. After four flights from Canada (we were delayed and re-routed), we ended up at the Sheraton without our bags. Stuart the concierge went out of his way to help us. He regularly contacted the airline for updates, and supplied us with toiletries. He also arranged taxis and dinner reservations for us during our stay, and recommended many attractions. We were frustrated without luggage, but Stuart's friendly personality kept us laughing and we had an unforgettable time in Edinburgh. It is our personal wish that the hotel recognizes him for his excellent service. If he ever wishes to come to Toronto, we would be honoured to be his tour guides! :)
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aside from that, the hotel was fantastic. Rooms were beautiful, clean and modern. The hotel was in a perfect location and we were able to walk to restaurants, pubs, shopping, and the castle.
reviews.title: Overall - happy.....

reviews.text: Stayed here last month with my Fiancé. Location wise we found it perfect, within easy reach to everything and everywhere that we needed. We didn’t get a nice view but what harm, rooms though....are small. They are lovely, very modern (not really consistent with the dated decor of the "bar") but I stress....a tad on the pokey side.
reviews.title: Reno has made a big difference!

reviews.text: I just had 3 fabulous nights at the Sheraton Grand Edinburgh and loved every day - especially the one spent on the rooftop spa.....what an experience. Will I be back? You bet I will!
reviews.title: The best spa in Scotland - without question!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for the England - v - Scotland Rugby match over a very cold weekend. The hotel was nearing a major refurb. The rooms and main areas were all done to a very contemporary italian style. The bedrooms have the bathroom with glass walls and 4 doors work as 2. So although very well thought out from a design point of view they dont offer much privacy for doing ones personal business ! Beds absolutely the most comfortable. Warm and very clean and new. The spa was great with steam, turkish and suna rooms - outside swim pool on the room. Good central location. Excellent breakfast.
reviews.title: Very attentive staff with excellent service skills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night on the back of a great price deal for what was a very expensive weekend given the International Rugby game taking place. In short, we cannot find any fault. I've stayed at SPG properties before and the standards of service I'd experienced previously were certainly maintained here. The staff were all courteous and professional but what sets this place apart was the room. Really comfortable bed, flatscreen TV, sensibly priced minibar, variable mood lighting in the bathroom and all round aesthetically pleasing decor. Yes, the Hotel is undergoing renovation, but it did not detract from a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Excellent standards throughout

reviews.text: The hotel is a short walk from Princess Street so ideal for sightseeing or business in the centre of town. It is close to Haymarket and Waverley train stations as well. Driving in this part of Edinburgh is a complete nightmare because of all the major roadworks for the tram system. My room was large, modern, clean, comfortable, well equipped and had a good view of the castle. The hotel is right next to the Edinburgh Exhibition and Conference Centre so ideal if you are going to an event there. I stayed at the hotel in early February 2012 and there was a major refurbishment underway so the main entrance, public spaces and dining facilities were blocked off and what is open is rather limited. You have to walk across the courtyard outside to get to breakfast. OK depending on the weather! Reception is also currently in a portacabin outside. The building work is somewhat unsightly but did not really impact on my trip which was short. There are lots of nice bars and restaurants close by. If you are going for longer check if the refurbishment is complete as this could spoil your holiday a bit. Service was friendly, breakfast was good, no real character to the hotel and it is expensive.
reviews.title: Great Location, Modern, No character & expensive

reviews.text: I have been in this hotel with my family, my parents my husband and I during Christmas 2010. It's Starwood excellence!! Feeling the tradition in a confortable, clean and polite hotel. Wanderfull SPA and very nice staff. Give a try to the afternoon breakfast
reviews.title: feeling in Scotland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on the 28th and 29th of october,we booked through the starwood web site and paid £123 for each night for a double room.When we arrived their car park was full,concierge took our key and parked our car in the car park later.Lovely lady on front desk gave us the happy news that we would be upgraded to an executive room.Room was very spacious with a Huge bed ,sofa and easy chair,we were at the back of the hotel so it was quiet,looked on to offices.The bathroom was small but very clean as was the room,lovely fluffy robes and slippers.We didn't eat at the hotel as we like going out, but did enjoy after dinner drinks in the Exchange bar,had a light breakfast at the spa cafe £5 each.I paid £20 extra for the spa facilities it is really worth it! it is fabulous,I stayed 2 hours trying all the various steam,sauna rooms,pool,relaxation area etc.We love this hotel because the staff are friendly,the hotel is very comfortable and it is near the city centre.This was our second visit it will not be our last.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay at the Sheraton

likes.liked: — comfortable rooms, friendly staff,near city centre

reviews.text: Having stayed at the Sheraton Sofia and the Sheraton Krakow, i expected the Edinburgh Grand to be just as good if not better.
reviews.title: Dusty, awful looking building.

likes.liked: — Great evening dining, very nicely cooked food.
likes.disliked: — terribly outdated accommodation, dusty and dirty, bed sagging.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the food was second to none in the evening, i left in the early hours for my flight in the morning and was advised by my wife that the food in the morning was truly awful, with the bacon burned and the staff miserable.
reviews.title: great hotel great city!

likes.disliked: — window in room didnt open very warm

reviews.text: The hotel has an excellent, if not expensive, health spa, although we didnt use it due to the fact that children were not allowed in at certain times (We take our son everywhere) i think we would have enjoyed it had we attended.
reviews.title: dump!

reviews.text: The room was dusty and dirty, the bathroom just as bad and dated, the WIFI was expensive (Nor free like Krakow) and the staff young and what we felt were inexperienced. The cleaners need some tuition on basic cleaning and dusting.
reviews.title: Shabby Round The Edges

reviews.text: we have just returned from a weekend away at this hotel. do not usually write reviews but thought it was necessary as i use this site alot when choosing hotels and cannot understand why anyone would have a bad word to say about this hotel.
reviews.title: Loved it!!
Very disappointed with the Sheraton
reviews.text: We have stayed in some nice places and this must be one of the best. From the moment we arrived we were well taken care of.

reviews.title: Must be something better than this.
reviews.text: the room was lovely, modern and clean with a huge bed, did find it odd that there were 2 single duvets on it but by end of stay i could actually see that it was a very good idea as it meant my boyfriend wasn't hogging the duvet all night because i had my own!

reviews.title: Not that grand afterall!
reviews.text: we never really ate in the hotel except for breakfast but that was good.

the location of the hotel is excellent, on one side you have the castle and the royal mile where all the tourist stuff is and to the left of the hotel are all the shops and bars where people obviously go for nights out.
reviews.title: Dirty, worn rooms, great food, fantastic SPA
Perfect pre-wedding luxury!!
reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night before our wedding and it really was the prefect way to relax before our big day. Our room on the 6th floor was spacious, immaculate and extremely comfortable, with views to die for of the castle. We took advantage of Escape at the Spa and used all the facilities. The rooftop hydro pool was a highlight, especially when it gets dark and the stars come out. Another favourite was the ceramic relaxation beds. Sheer bliss! Altogether an excellent stay. Great rooms, great service, great spa! 5 stars.

reviews.title: Grand Sheraton
reviews.text: Fantastic place in the whole of Edinburgh. Excellant location, services,and the staff from the moment we arrived were really helpful and friendly.....always smiling and can't do enough for you! I can honestly say that this is the nicest hotel I've stayed in ever! Rooms are

reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay
reviews.text: I could ramble on about this hotel for pages but trust me this is definitely worth the money.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel, but little niggles prevent a 5-star review
reviews.text: Mr Singh. 02/04/2011. Room 351

reviews.title: Where is the light switch for the bathroom?
reviews.text: Kind Regards

Upon arrival at the Sharaton Grand, I knew I'd made the right choice for accommodations. The hotel was immaculate and staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room was well appointed and spotless. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in while traveling!
reviews.title: A Scottish Dream!

reviews.text: We had the Scottish breakfast buffet one morning, which was delicious and gave me a chance to try the local cuisine. (I did skip the haggis, though!). It was a bit pricey, but worth it in terms of quality and convenience. The hotel did charge quite a lot for internet access, which was annoying. I didn't get a chance to try the spa facilities, but they looked spot on.
reviews.title: Ab Fab!!!!

reviews.text: One last note: the location of this hotel was fabulous. Close to all of the historic city attractions and also near the EICC for conference purposes.
reviews.title: lovely make-over

reviews.text: Stayed here for the first time and now has to be our priority choice when staying in Edinburgh. Staff welcoming, friendly and very helpful. Rooms very nice and mega comfy beds!! Breakfast very good but buffet could have been set out better this will not put us off going back. Sadly didn't use spa/pool but looks fabulous!!
reviews.title: Modern clean hotel, a perfect stay!

reviews.text: The recent make-over of this hotel is very good. The mood lighting in the bathroom was super - unfortunately the lack of power in the shower spoilt it, why on earth didn't they put in power showers. Breakfast was great but they are using three or four different spaces whilst the dining room is being refurbished and service was very slow. All the staff were excellent, especially those on reception. Very convenient for all the sights in the city.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.text: My sister and I have just had a very relaxing break in the Sheraton. We had a twin room which was spotlessly clean and comfortable. The spa was amazing with lots of different facilities to experience and enjoy. The food and wine was excellent. The waitress was helpful and knowledgeable when we asked for advice with our choice of wine. All the staff were very pleasant and attentive and made our stay very enjoyable. We did not want to come home and cannot wait to come again. I cannot fault the experience in any way.
reviews.title: Sheraton Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just come back from a lovely weekend break at this very smart hotel.This was a combined birthday/valentines treat so I splashed out on a club room. Well worth the extra money as this gave us free access to the Club Lounge and the Spa facilities. The club lounge was available all day for tea/coffee and homemade cookies, but you could have your breakfast there (continental) and between 5.30 - 7.30 drinks and lovely canapes are available, all at no extra cost. We spent a couple of hours in the spa using the thermal suites and pools, lovely experience! The hotel itself was immaculate and had very friendly staff. Our room was more than adequate with a huge comfy bed and very modern amenities such as mood lighting. The bar and restaurant areas were also very good, great selection of cocktails. For an extra £5 you can upgrade your breakfast from the Club Lounge to the restaurant, this is really good value as there is so much to choose from. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Princes Street and all sorts of lovely bars and restaurants. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Sheraton, quite expensive but well worth it for a special occasion.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed as a couple in a Castle View Room on the 5th floor for one night.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: From arrival the staff were courteous and attentive and even though we were early and expected to leave our bags with reception to check in later our room was actually ready for us.
reviews.title: Sheraton Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was immaculate with a huge comfy bed and modern decor. The bathroom has a separate shower cubicle from the bath and there is mood lighting in the bathroom which gives off most colours which was a novelty! Robes and slippers are provided in the wardrobe with an iron and ironing board. There's also a minibar and the usual complimentary tea/coffee making facilities. Contactless key cards are used to open the room doors and to operate the lifts which we were also impressed with.
reviews.title: Club room facilities fantastic!

reviews.text: Went here on a Business trip, Staff were really helpful, Breakfast was wonderful. The Television in my bedroom had broken, but this was fixed quickly. Would reccomend this to anyone on a business trip.
reviews.title: Excellent service and rooms

reviews.text: The best hotel I've stayed in for quite a while. Service excellent, room excellent and clean, club lounge very civilised. The gym in the Spa building is very well equipped. My only gripe is that while working in my room in the morning, I was distracted by the noise of the refurbishments outside (pneumatic drill). My room was at the front of the building so the noise was more noticeable.
reviews.title: Would be 5/5 if renovations complete

reviews.text: A complete renovation underway so different from the last time we were here. The rooms are now modern with a Scottish flare. Lobby not finished with detours around the corridors of the hotel. I expect my excellent rating will stand when it is finished. For SPG members, this place is exactly what you expect, home away from home. All service professional and staff incredibly warm and inviting. The spa is well described on the web and no disappointments. Reasonable prices for everything, even the mini bar, at a pound fifty for a coke. Beautifully decorated, I can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: How renovations should be done. A perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sheraton, Edinburgh is pretty much what you would expect from this SPG brand in it's most sought after city centres. The location is central within easy walking distance of the tourist sites, business, bars and restaurants. We were given a Club level room which felt surprisingly small. Good decor, newly refurbished, funky bathroom (albeit it felt like the room was 'wrapped around' the bathroom area).
reviews.title: Good location, comfortable but small rooms

reviews.text: The current construction work makes for a surprising arrival at the temporary reception, and the route to the hotel rooms was fairly convoluted, but staff were friendly and helpful, so this wasn't a problem.
reviews.title: Superb service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited on the weekend of 17th Feb 2012 and were definitely caught out here. We have stayed here several times before, although not for a few months, and as a consequence like all hotels I know well I never bother to read TripAdvisor reviews for places I'm familiar with. Sadly, the construction work has rendered much of the hotel out of use. Reception is a Portakabin in the car park, and access is via the Spa - it's a bit maze-like and our room was quite a journey! On site facilities apart from the spa are, well, minimal although there is a car park... and that's about it. On checkout, Jude tried to persuade me their Santini restaurant was an adequate replacement for all the bars, seating areas, restaurants that are not available - not so. Also, entry and exit for pedestrians is via the vehicle ramp on to the Western Approach Road - not a very pretty route, and not nice at all at night. As ever the staff were all very friendly, and the rooms are pretty good - large and well appointed. As an SPG member I was on a good deal but had I been charged full whack I would have not paid up. Apparently all work is due to be done by the end of Feb so hopefully this is just me getting it off my chest as opposed to a warning to others!
reviews.title: Caught out by construction

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend and I couldn't fault it if I tried !! Even though the hotel has some work getting done this did not effect our stay even slightly. The staff were the most friendly and helpful we have ever came across. Not one of them walked by us without greeting us and were happy to help with any enquiry. Room service was beautiful. The room itself was also lovely. Booked the spa and didn't want to leave was so relaxing and has plenty facilities. Overall our stay was so good we are looking to stay again very soon. Thank you for a lovely stay xxx
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: My partner and I have just returned from here for a weekend away, and found it to be fantastic. Yes, there are construction works going on (due to finish in March) but they didn't interfere with our stay at all. We had a castle view club room, which was clean,spacious and on the top floor so quiet and uk disturbed. Floor 5 seems to be used as a thoroughfare to the spa so wouldnt recommend that! Club lounge was OK (good canapés in the evenings and breakfast choice was good even at the end of the serving time). Spa was relaxing and didn't feel busy at all - although they did recommend we go down beforehand and check how busy it is before booking in, definitely a good idea on the weekends. The only minor complaint was the lack of signs both to the hotel and around the hotel and spa - confusing at times, non-existent at others! Overall though, a great hotel in a perfect location.
reviews.title: Great place for a weekend stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for a little Valentine treat. The modern decor of the room was lovely and very comfortable. Room was peaceful despite hotel being in the city centre and undergoing renovations. Hotel is big and signage not very good. Made use of the pool and thermal suite which was rather good although very busy on a Saturday. Also had to pay £30 each extra to use thermal suite (steam rooms, saunas, rooftop pool). The room just comes with access to the swimming pool, cleopatra baths and gym, unless it is a club room.
reviews.title: Lovely decor and excellent customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner at Santini's restaurant was outstanding. Breakfast was average although plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, esp the Club Floor, will be amazing post renovation!

reviews.text: I booked this hotel via Hotwire and got a great deal. Everything was great. The hotel is very stylish, super clean, has great location, has good size rooms etc. etc. However I did not understand why the internet would not be free in such a five star hotel. The phone service was also SUPER expensive.
reviews.title: why to charge for internet?

reviews.text: Location of this hotel is a bit 'out of the way' not by far but not quite central. But the hotel itself makes up for the walk to it. Spotlessly clean, warm, cosy and grand with great breakfast. Great spa and great breakfast room ; crisp newspapers available each morning - i could have relaxed there all day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well located within easy walking distance to Edinburgh castle and the golden mile shopping centre. Clean tidy and quite comfortable with good size rooms. In house Bar and restaurant quite good. Good selection for breakfast.

Rooms are 5 star with All you need. The bed is so nice that you don't mind staying in and relax (some time) Loved the gym and Spa. Very spacious with State of the Art Equipment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just had the most amazing Easter Weekend break at The Sheraton. We only live an hour away so travelling was easy which was what we wanted. We had a classic room which was fantastic, everything you need. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The staff were first class from reception to bar staff and housekeeping. We only ate breakfast but it was delicious and unbelievable choice. The lounge bar in the evening was so relaxing, I just loved being there. I actually wanted to stay an extra night but we had family commitments. We have stayed in several 5* hotels and been so dissapointed, we will definatly return to the Sheraton.
reviews.title: Wanted to stay longer!

reviews.text: This was my third stay at the Sheraton and each time it gets better and better. The staff here are the most attentive I have ever encountered. Since my last stay the rooms have been tastefully renovated. The beds are comfortable and we had a great view of the Edinburgh castle. The location is excellent, only a stones throw to Princess Street and the Castle.
reviews.title: 5 Star service at its finest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the first night we had dinner and drinks in the hotel bar which was unforgettable. The cocktails here are the best in Edinburgh!! Evete who looked after us could not have done enough and the staff even agreed to make us drinks that were not on the menu.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but with a big customer service issue!

reviews.text: On our second night we dined in the Santini Restaurant at the hotel which was another unforgettable experience. The staff were extremely knowledgeable of both the food and wine menus. The selection and variety is fantastic in this restaurant not to mention the outstanding value for money.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A late check-out was organised for us so that we could have some time in the amazing one spa. The cleanliness of this spa is a credit to the team there. The roof top pool is a must if staying at the Sheraton and well worth the extra few pounds!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic stay in Castle Suite 353

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a real mixed bag of feelings while staying at this hotel. The room was fine. Clean and pleasant enough. However, there was one problem I found completely unsatisfactory. Listen to this. The plug in the sink in the bathroom can only be engaged by putting your hand into the sink and fiddling with the plug. "It is a design fault", I was told, when I asked about this at the reception. Now, I'm not the most fussy person in the world, but to be asked to feel about in dirty water to empty the sink is totally unacceptable, especially given the rates.
reviews.title: Satisfactory

reviews.text: Booked 2 nights at the Sheraton, Edinburgh with a friend and I can honestly say the stay was fantastic. Every member of staff we spoke to from our arrival to our departure was very friendly, very professional and very helpful, but not in an annoying way as you can often find in good hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our twin room was bright, spacious, great bathroom with funky lighting, super comfy beds AND we were lucky enough to have a castle view. The hotel is set back from the main road and I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was, both from outside noise but also inside, no corridor noise or slamming doors.

reviews.text: We decided to use the thermal suite and hydropool on our last day which was great. You have to pay extra, but it is worth it, 3 hours flew past before we realised.

description: The Sheraton Grand has been Edinburgh's gathering place for many years, and following a complete refurbishment, it's the perfect time to rediscover this unique destination. From the moment you set foot inside the granite-floored lobby, you'll feel welcome. One Square, our new restaurant and bar, serves a delicious range of classic British dishes all day long, while our beautiful new bedrooms blend contemporary comfort and Scottish materials with cutting-edge technology. Of course, some things at the Sheraton have always been unbeatable, from One Spa's iconic rooftop Hydropool, to the breathtaking views of Edinburgh Castle. We can't wait to share them with you.
